resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
wesm opened a new pull request #7522:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7522


   An array object was failing to be decref'd on the DatetimeTZ conversion path. The code is slightly complicated by the different calling reference ownership semantics of the Array/ChunkedArray conversion path (which expects to own the created array when it calls `GetSeriesResult` while the `GetResultBlock` code retains its array in a `OwnedRefNoGIL`). This was the simplest thing that fixed the memory leak for me. There is leak checking code that can be used to verify this in python/scripts/test_leak.py (just run the script).

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [Python] Memory leak on read from parquet file with UTC timestamps using pandas
fields.environment: Tested using pyarrow 0.17.0, pandas 1.0.3, python 3.7.5, mojave (macos). Also tested using pyarrow 0.16.0, pandas 1.0.3, python 3.8.2, ubuntu 20.04 (linux).

comments.body: Another observation: with setting {{split_blocks=True}}, I don't see the issue (so it might be related to the introduction of that keyword)

> Did you get the same issue on pyarrow 0.16 (since you mentioned you tested that as well), or is it only present since 0.17?

Yes. Both 0.17.0 and 0.16.0 leak memory, both with my example code and yours.
I'm looking at this. I don't see a difference between split_blocks=False/True.
